Transcript:
Ava: Olivia, I don't think you should be anywhere around here. I can't 
promise you what Coop's going to do.

Olivia: I'm not worried about Coop. We have to talk. There are things that 
you need to hear.
Ashlee: Here you go.
Dinah: Thank you.
Ashlee: Oh, is that "Springfield Burns"? I love gossip.
Dinah: Well, you live in the right town.
Ashlee: Isn't that...?
Dinah: Yep.
Ashlee: But isn't he with...?
Dinah: Yeah.
Ashlee: But...?
Dinah: Yeah.
Ashlee: What...?

Dinah: Yeah. Well, you know what? I think it's going to be interesting to see 
what happens to these two.

Marina: Very funny, guys, very funny. Yeah, someone sent me this link in my 
e-mail.
Mallet: What did I miss? What's going on?
Lizzie: Mom, you and Uncle Rick?

Beth: No, no, of course not. This is Jonathan. You can't believe anything 
that he says. Alan, I can explain this.
Alan: Excuse me.
Beth: Alan.
Mel: Is it true? Is it true?
Rick: Mel... my wife never did anything to you. You're going to pay for this!
Jonathan: Okay. Whatever. So much for the perfect family, huh?
Tammy: Are you okay?
Remy: I'm going to go check on Mel.
Jonathan: That had to be done.
Tammy: Why? To get back at Beth and Alan?
Jonathan: No. Now you can see that they're no better than us.

Tammy: Jonathan, you didn't do this to hurt Alan. You hurt all of these 
people because you thought you were losing me.
Olivia: Look, I know we've been through a lot in the past...
Ava: Just stop, okay? I know what you're going to say.
Olivia: I don't think you do.

Ava: Let me guess. I haven't been myself lately because my little girl, she's 
been sick. And if you really cared about Emma, then you wouldn't take her mommy 
away from her.
Olivia: Are you done?
Ava: Do you know why I know what you're going to say to me?
Olivia: I don't care about that.

Ava: You should care about that. I stopped giving a damn about you a long 
time ago. I am so conflicted about you leaving me to die in that fire that I 
have completely excused everything that you've done to me after that. Do you 
realize what you've done to me, Olivia?
Olivia: Please, just...

Ava: You tried to push me off the balcony at Towers, you tried to mow me over 
with a car. When that didn't work, you hired somebody to try to take me out. Out 
of everybody that I've met in my entire life, I have never met anyone like you.
Olivia: I imagine that's true. So what about your life?
Ava: What?
Olivia: Tell me about your life. I want to understand you.

Ava: Why do you care? I don't know what this is about. I don't care actually 
what this is about. I'm going to finely make you pay for what you've done to me.

Olivia: You say that. You said that last night and you said it just now, but 
you haven't gone to the police.
Ava: No, I haven't because I have something much different in mind for you.
Mallet: Why do I feel like a substitute teacher walking into the classroom?
Marina: What's with the cameras?

Mallet: Oh, you know my episode of "The Law"? It did really well, so they're 
thinking about giving me my own show.
Marina: Great.

Mallet: Guys, you can take five. Thanks. You know, it's never a good sign 
when you walk into a room and everybody stops laughing.
Marina: It's nothing.

Mallet: What? "Mallet and Marina: Does Mallet want to crack the case or crack 
Marina's panties?" That's great. That's great. You've got to love this blogger. 
Hey, guys, show's over.
Marina: They are children.
Mallet: Well, I didn't see you here before.

Dinah: I didn't know if this was still your desk or if, you know, your new 
girlfriend and you are sharing one now.

Beth: We need to discuss what happened tonight, Alan. ( Verdi's "La Traviata" 
playing)

Alan: "La Traviata." One of my favorite Verdi operas. You know what the 
translation of "La Traviata" is, Beth?
Beth: No, no, I don’t.
Alan: "The woman who strayed." Brandy?
Beth: What are you going to do to me, Alan?
Mel: Just leave me alone!

Rick: Stop, please. You almost crashed the car three times on the way home. 
Would you just give me a chance to explain?

Mel: Explain?! Explain what? We all saw it. You did not deny it. What do you 
want to explain? As if the damage wasn't bad enough, as if me being humiliated 
in front of those people was not bad enough, now you want to explain, like I'm 
too stupid to know what's going on. Or maybe there's an excuse.
Rick: There is no excuse.
Mel:, Well, then, we're done. Let go of me.
Rick: Don't say that. Don't say it, please.

Mel: God. Beth? It had to be her, right? Just when I thought we were on our 
way back to something good, just when I thought it was something I never 
doubted.
Rick: It didn't seem that way to me.

Mel: You know, I had trouble with what you did with Phillip. But I was 
getting over it, and I never gave up on our marriage.
Rick: Our marriage felt like it was dead.
Mel: But it wasn’t. It wasn't, we were getting better.

Rick: Yes, lately Mel, we've been... but for the last couple of years you 
wouldn't touch me. You wouldn't even look me in the eye. You wouldn't even talk 
to me.
Mel: Oh, you were an ass and now it's my fault?
Rick: No, it's not your fault.

Mel: You know, I found a key card in your pocket when I was trying to put a 
love note in your pocket, and I pushed down the questions. I just tried to 
ignore it.
Rick: You kick me out of our bed. I thought our marriage was over.
Mel: Oh, really. And what did you feel, alone?
Rick: Yes, I felt alone. So I turned to an old friend for comfort.
Mel: Oh, comfort.
Rick: It was a mistake and I was wrong, and I wanted to stop it.
Mel: How long? It was obviously not one time. How long?
Rick: No, it wasn't one time.
Mel: It was a full-blown affair, you son of a bitch!

Tammy: You can tell me the truth, Jonathan. Why did you announce this secret 
tonight?

Jonathan: What do you want me to say, Tammy, I did it to prove a point? I 
did.
Tammy: What point?

Jonathan: That people have things underneath the surface, and when you're 
sweet and trusting like you are, people take advantage of that.

Tammy: Jealousy, payback. You crushed Remy’s family to get back at him for 
spending time with me?

Jonathan: Remy’s... I'm sick of him always being around you. I'm sick of him 
always getting to be there to say the perfect thing to you. I am sick of him 
holding his family over us like they're so fantastic, and they do awful things 
just like everybody else? Tammy, come on. He is one of those hypocrites, one of 
those people who wanted --who never wanted us to be together in the first place.

Tammy: Mel was destroyed tonight and she helped us. She helped you. Where did 
you even get that photo?

Jonathan: I caught Beth and Rick before the trial. I just kept it in case we 
lost.

Tammy: Well, we didn’t. And you know what? I like Remy’s family. I have known 
them for longer than I've known you, and they have always been there for me. 
They were there for me when I needed them, and you want to punish them for that?

Jonathan: They're pulling you away from me. You don't need them. We need each 
other, okay? Not that...

Tammy: Hey! Hey, you guys, stop it! Stop. Stop it. Jonathan, stop it! Stop 
it, stop it!
Olivia: Hold up. Wait, wait before you start...
Ava: Stop it.
Olivia: ...With all the threats.
Ava: You are going to turn yourself in.
Olivia: I'm sorry, what was that?

Ava: Either you go down to the station and you admit to everything that 
you've done or I will. It's the right thing to do.

Olivia: For who? For you? So you don't have to watch Emma grow up knowing 
that you're the one who put her mother in jail for the next 20 years?

Ava: If I take you down there, you are going to get a long, long prison 
sentence but if you go down there and confess, maybe they'll have a little mercy 
on you.
Olivia: Oh my gosh. You don't have to press charges.
Ava: So, what, you can come after me again?
Olivia: I'm not going to come after you.

Ava: I don't believe that. I feel sorry for Emma. I really do. I lost my 
mother when I was a kid. I would never wish that on anyone, even if you are her 
mother.
Olivia: Please don't say that.
Ava: She doesn't deserve to suffer, but you do, and you will.

Marina: Very mature. I'm glad to know that our streets are being protected by 
a bunch of six year olds. ( Laughter ) When I find this blogger, I'm taking off 
the badge for five minutes.

Dinah: I hear that she is a detective in training. You're just the guy to 
break her in, aren't you?
Mallet: Stop.
Dinah: Do you get kinky with your handcuffs?
Mallet: Okay, enough. Stop.

Dinah: Now, you were a warden. I mean, do you guys lock each other up in your 
prison of love?

Mallet: I don't even know what that last one means. And now, it is time for 
you to go.
Dinah: Was Chicago all work and no play?
Mallet: Do you believe everything you read online?

Dinah: Well, I already knew Harley and Gus stopped by to take a statement 
about the break-in.
Mallet: No, Harley and Gus would never spill anything like that, to anyone.
Dinah: Oh, really, is that a police thing? A silence code thing?

Mallet: Yeah, yeah exactly. You know what? Maybe you found out about the trip 
and then you tipped off the blogger. No, no, no, you know what? Maybe you are 
the blogger and maybe it's time we went in that other room and had a little Q&A, 
right? Maybe said it out loud, a little interrogation? What do you think?
Dinah: No.
Mallet: Got something to tell me?

Dinah: No, I have nothing to tell you because your accusations and your 
apparent lack of trust is reminding me why I dumped your butt.
Mallet: I dumped you. And it's a nice butt.
Alan: You're my wife, Beth, I'm not going to hurt you.
Beth: You haven't said a word about what happened tonight.

Alan: Look, let's not pretend that our marriage started with love. It didn’t. 
It was a business arrangement that you and I both agreed upon. But you know 
something, Beth? I thought that our relationship was really moving toward a real 
marriage.

Beth: Alan, what happened with Rick, I needed it. I had just lost the baby. I 
just found out that Phillip was alive, that you had kept it from me even while 
we were creating that baby. I was angry at you, and Rick... Rick reminded me of 
a time when I felt good and whole.
Alan: Really? When was that?
Beth: When Mindy and Rick and Phillip and I were together.

Alan: Reality check, Beth. That was then. This is now. Because when you 
became Mrs. Alan Spaulding, you gave that part of yourself up for power and 
money. That's the deal you made with your soul.
Beth: Alan, that is still in me. That's still... it's still a part of me.

Alan: Really? You want to go back being the old Beth, the weak Beth, 
powerless, the one at the mercy of others? Really? Well, if that is what will 
make you feel whole, be my guest. Go out the door and be with Rick Bauer. But 
you will leave penniless and with only the clothes on your back. Only I'm not 
going to stop you.
Beth: And what if I want to stay?

Alan: Then go upstairs and think about our wedding vows. Specifically the one 
that says "Till death do we part."
Rick: We had some great memories out here.
Mel: You know, I... I can't even remember a single one.

Rick: Sweetheart, I can't tell you how ashamed I am of what I did and how 
sorry I am.

Mel: Well, if I forgive you right now, would you leave? Or would you force 
your way into my life whether I like it or not?
Rick: Mel, we have a daughter together.

Mel: Well, she's always been daddy's little girl, so I'm sure she'll forgive 
you.
Rick: So we just can't save our marriage, is that what you're saying?

Mel: How can we save our marriage? When the past-- your friendship with 
Phillip, the four musketeers, Beth-- they all mean more to you than me.
Rick: That is not true!
Mel: Then why did you sleep with her?

Rick: I already told you! That answer's not going to change. But I can. I can 
be better than that. Mel, I love you.
Mel: Stop it.

Rick: I love you and I know that you love me in spite of what I just did to 
you. All I'm asking... all I'm asking is for you to believe in us one last time 
and I swear to you, I will never let you down again.

Tammy: Hey, hey, hey, stop it. Hey, you guys, stop it! Okay, that's enough. ( 
Grunting ) That's enough! That is enough! Stop it.

Lizzie: Are we done? You guys don't have to shake, but can we at least agree 
on who leaves?
Remy: Let him go, he'll sucker punch you.
Jonathan: I'm not going to sucker punch you, I will be right in your face.
Remy: Good, that way I can see your busted nose.
Tammy: That's enough. Both of you, stop it.
Jonathan: You keep your hands off my girl.
Remy: What about your wife?
Lizzie: Hey, enough. This is not good for the baby, okay?
Maitre'd: I'd like you to leave, sir.
Jonathan: What? He threw the first punch.
Maitre'd: Now, or I call the cops.
Remy: I am the cops.
Jonathan: Pig. Hey, where are you going? Can I just...

Tammy: What are you going to say? You didn't trust me to let me spend some 
time with a friend.

Jonathan: Hey, he wants to be more than your friend, Tammy. Can you not see 
that?

Tammy: So what? I don’t. I was just happy to have somebody care enough to 
pick me up off the floor when I was so depressed to not be with you.

Jonathan: I'm sorry, but you know me. You know why I went crazy. I thought I 
was going to lose you.

Tammy: Do you really think after everything that we've been through-- for 
that matter, do you think anyone in this town thinks that after anything that 
we've been through-- that I would ever be with anybody else?
Jonathan: No, but...
Tammy: I can't be around you. I've got to go.

Jonathan: Can I have a bottle? I don't care what it is. Can I have a bottle 
now?
Bartender: Here.

Jonathan: Here's to my life. May I never get it right. What are you smiling 
about?

Lizzie: I was just thinking about how messed up I am, too. Maybe that's why 
we're so good together.

Jonathan: Yeah. Is that what it is? Okay, well, then, here's to both of us, 
may we both have what we deserve.

Tammy: Remy, don't tell me not to apologize when this is all my fault. If I 
hadn't dragged you into this...
Remy: There's only three people to blame: Rick, Beth, and our friend Johnny.
Tammy: I'm so sorry about your sister. Is she going to be all right?

Remy: She's the strongest person I know, but nobody's ready for something 
like this. Rick's lucky we were in public.
Tammy: Well, that didn't stop you from hitting Jonathan.

Remy: Can you really defend him after tonight? I mean, do you see what kind 
of person he is? Can you honestly, honestly tell me he wouldn't do anything to 
hurt you?
Tammy: Jonathan loves me.
Remy: Is that the kind of love you want in your life?
Tammy: I... I don't know.

Rick: You listen to me. Listen to me. You, Jude and Leah are the most 
important things in my life. It's all I have.

Mel: Oh, really? How important was I when you were screwing Beth? And those 
moments when you could have turned around but you didn't?

Rick: You kicked me out of the house. "Go have an affair, Rick." You said it 
to me. "Go have an affair."
Mel: Really? You're going to stand here and blame this one on me?

Rick: No, all I'm saying is it didn't seem to matter to you whether I was 
around the house or not. You wouldn't talk to me, you wouldn't look at me.

Mel: You were just looking for an excuse, okay? Because if I would have known 
you would have listened to what I said, I would have divorced you right there.

Rick: Neither one of us... no, no, neither one of us wanted it then and we 
don't want it now. It's over with Beth. I stopped it. It's done.
Mel: Really? You ended it?
Rick: Yes.

Mel: You ended it? How did it end, Rick? When I started forgiving you again, 
did you call your backup and you told her, "Don't call me again?"
Rick: Doesn't matter.
Mel: When did it end with Beth, Rick? Is it even over?
Rick: Yes.
Mel: When?
Rick: Tonight.

Alan: That's enough for now. Shut the door behind you. Do you have something 
else you would like to say?
Beth: I am not weak, Alan.
Alan: Then what do you call your betrayal of me with Rick Bauer, huh?

Beth: Do you remember the cabin? Hmm? Do you remember what I did to you up at 
the cabin?
Alan: I'll never forget it.

Beth: Good. Disrespecting me is part and parcel of the way you live your 
life, Alan. You don't even know you do it. When you do show me respect, or 
approval, or affection, it's more like for a dog who's just done a trick. It's 
not for your wife.
Alan: And your point would be, Beth?

Beth: My point is that my affair with Rick, this whole pathetic train wreck 
you call a life, didn't just happen, and you know that. You know in that cramped 
airless box you call a soul that you created all of this.

Alan: Yeah, that's right. I bring it on myself. How many times have I heard 
that refrain?

Beth: And you know what the funny thing is, Alan? With all of your power and 
all your money, you don't know how to fix it. You want to be loved but you don't 
know how to give love. So you thrash around like a fish on a hook, so convinced 
of your own superiority that you don't do anything about it.
Alan: You stumbled off the groveling path. Best find your way back, Beth.

Beth: No, I will... I will, damn it, be heard. You drove me to that affair. 
You drove Lizzie out of this house, and you drove Phillip to madness. You ruin 
everything you touch.

Alan: Enough. I've had enough of this. Go up and tell Hilda to make up the 
spare room if you decide to stay. If not, go out. Find yourself. You know, Beth, 
you really are a broken person. Count yourself lucky that I'm here to pick up 
the pieces.
Beth: I am not finished with you.
Alan: Knowing you, you'll be here in the morning. Breakfast at 7:00.
Frank: Okay, we need to talk about my daughter.
Mallet: Frank, please, not you, too.
Frank: Is it true?

Mallet: Marina would not even want me to... to honor that question, dignify 
that question with a response, Frank. Come on.

Frank: Well, I thought I would give my best friend the benefit of the doubt 
here.
Mallet: Frank, come on, man, you look like you're going to slug me.

Frank: Well, right now I could go either way, so why don't you just answer 
the question?

Mallet: There is nothing going on between me and Marina. I repeat, nothing 
going on. Does everybody want me to say that for the 100th time?

Frank: Look, I know that blog's being burning a lot of people in town, but 
come on, I mean, you've taken a lot of hits.

Mallet: Look, I'm not worried about me, okay? I'm just... Marina's going to 
get a lot of heat for this. I don't want her to get all of that ridicule, okay? 
I've got a camera crew following me a lot these days. I was kind of thinking 
about just dropping her, you know? Let another detective train her. Let another 
detective get her up to speed. And I'll find someone else to help me nail the 
Springfield Burns blogger.

Marina: You dump me and that blogger's going to be the least of your 
problems.
Dinah: Give me the strongest thing you've got, no ice.
Olivia: Make it two.
Dinah: Everything okay?
Olivia: I'll give you one guess.

Dinah: Well, it is so good to hear that somebody else is as miserable as I 
am. Who's the guy?
Olivia: What?

Dinah: Well, I mean, I don't think a girl gets riled up about anything other 
than a... her guy or her kids so...
Olivia: I just did something terrible.

Dinah: I, well... well, okay, well, join the club. Or rejoin the club. 
Something terrible to whom?
Olivia: My daughter.
Dinah: Emma? I find that hard to believe.
Olivia: My other daughter.
Dinah: You have another daughter?
Olivia: I had her when I was 16.
Dinah: Wait a minute so that would make her around....
Olivia: The same age as Ava Peralta.
Dinah: Ava?
Ashlee: Ladies, two Turkish coffees.
Dinah: Thank you.
Olivia: Thank you.
Dinah: Ava?
Olivia: I know.
Dinah: But you hate Ava.
Olivia: I know.
Dinah: And you didn't know that she was yours?
Olivia: No.
Dinah: Of course you didn’t. Of course, how could you? I'm sorry.
Olivia: I put her up for adoption.

Dinah: So that's why you were asking me all of those questions because you 
had to give her up when you were so young.

Olivia: I was young. There were so many reasons, but it doesn’t matter. What 
matters is that I... accidentally tried to hurt her. I hired a guy to hurt her.
Dinah: Hurt her?
Olivia: I blamed her for Emma nearly dying.
Dinah: So you put a hit out for her?
Olivia: It was supposed to be more of a smack. Not a hit... smack.
Dinah: I thought my life was cursed. Excuse me.

Olivia: She's all right. She wasn't hurt, thank goodness, but the worst part 
is this hatred that I feel for her. It's been almost irrational, but she knows 
and she's going to go to the cops if I don't do it first.
Dinah: Well, you know, kids can be ungrateful sometimes.

Olivia: No, no, she doesn't know. She doesn't know she's my daughter and I 
would really appreciate if you wouldn't tell anybody.

Ava: Clock is ticking, Olivia. You better take care of what you need to take 
care of by tomorrow or I'll do what I have to do.

Marina: Did either one of you honestly think you were going to get away with 
this?

Frank: Well, honey, I just figured since I was the chief of police here that 
I would pretty much...

Marina: You are not dumping me because you got teased on the playground, and 
you are not dropping me from this case because Robocop here asks you to.

Frank: Okay, so exactly how would you like to work it, then? Would you like 
to become the new chief of police here and then you make all the calls?

Marina: Sure. And you, Mr. TV star, I would be the perfect partner for your 
demographics. I'll try not to steal all the spotlight.
Mallet: Okay, thank you. I appreciate that.
Frank: Marina, we're talking about the case here, not the show.

Marina: Well, I think that we could use this thing that people say we're 
having.
Frank: I don't like it.
Mallet: No, hold on, Frank. I think she's got a point.
Marina: Thank you.

Mallet: You know, I was only suggesting moving you off the case because I 
didn't want you to...

Marina: To spare my delicate female sensibilities? Please. I am tougher than 
you are.
Frank: Okay, I think we all know that. Anyway, Marina stay off the internet.
Mallet: So we cleared that up?

Marina: I think we've got good chemistry together, Mallet. On the job, I 
mean.
Mallet: Uh-huh. And I like you... your work ethic.
Marina: We are so out of here.
Mallet: Yeah, let's go.

Mel: Yeah, it's all coming together now. You met up with Beth at the bar when 
you were supposedly taking a call. Is that when it happened? In between drink 
orders?
Rick: No. We hadn't seen each other for a while. We haven’t...

Mel: Right, of course not, because you thought you were going to get lucky 
with me again. You put Beth on the sidelines. I'm sure you kept her on the 
sidelines just in case things didn't work out for us.
Rick: That's not how it is.

Mel: Really, Rick? Really? If we were to take a break now, or maybe things 
got a little rocky, what would just stop you from doing it again? Your 
conscience? Well, you already proved that didn't work.

Rick: Okay. You're angry and you have a right to be. You have a right to dish 
out everything you're giving me but you have to know on a certain level how much 
you mean to me.

Mel: I knew, or at least I thought I knew. See, you don't get it, Rick. 
That's the consequences of cheating, is I don't believe a single word you're 
saying to me right now.
Rick: Listen to me. I will do whatever it takes to keep our family together.

Mel: You know, I'd say we stopped being a family the minute Jonathan showed 
the photo.
Rick: Don't say that.
Mel: What?
Rick: It's not true.

Mel: Am I supposed to continue believing that we have something special? That 
you have that heart beating in your chest for some reason?
Rick: So you wish I was dead? Is that it?

Mel: No, I wish you'd get out of my face. Get out of this house. Go get your 
stuff and go to your hotel room. I'm sure you still have the key.
Jonathan: She's right up there. I am standing directly underneath her window.
Lizzie: Tammy's? Is that why we're here? Are you crazy?
Jonathan: Yes. Everyone knows that.
Lizzie: No, I meant are you stupid? We're going to get caught.
Jonathan: I don't care. I don't care. I don't care one damn bit.
Lizzie: No, of course not.

Tammy: Listen, I just... I want to be real clear about something. Sit down. I 
really believe that Jonathan would never, ever do anything to intentionally hurt 
me. He just... he takes shots sometimes at the world and at the people in his 
life and sometimes I get caught in the crossfire. But I knew that going into 
this relationship. That's kind of what I signed up for. Oh, sorry.

Remy: On... on duty, there's these battered women. They say their husbands 
beat them but they know they love them.
Tammy: Okay, I am not a battered woman.

Remy: They say that, too. Is this the kind of life you want for yourself? 
Because if you want out, not a single person in this town would blame you.
Ava: Frank.
Frank: Hey, Ava.
Ava: Hi.

Frank: Hi, can I help you with something? Oh, are you here about that guy 
what was in the car?
Ava: I was actually just checking to see if you're going to be in tomorrow.
Frank: There's a pretty good chance of that. Why?

Ava: There is something that I wanted to, you know, talk to you about 
tomorrow. I just wanted to make sure that you were going to be here.
Frank: We can talk about it right now, if you want.
Ava: No. Tomorrow's fine.
Frank: Okay.

Dinah: Olivia, you don't have any friends in this town. I'm the closest thing 
you've got.
Olivia: Okay, and?

Dinah: And, since I have been in prison, I am not so unfamiliar with a 
situation like this.
Olivia: See, I can’t... I can't go to prison. I can't

Dinah: Exactly. Which is why I don't think you should be leaning on 
do-gooders like Buzz or Mallet. I think they have too many scruples to give you 
what you need.
Olivia: Buzz is no saint.

Dinah: Well, yeah, well, he's close enough. What I'm saying, in order to save 
your butt, is I think you should find a man you can get comfy with who has 
shades of gray, who's above the law and who can give you what you want.
Olivia: Oh, God. See?

Dinah: See? Now that's what I'm talking about. He dumps me for that little 
slut.
Olivia: You know what? I need a fixer. You're right. Thanks.
Dinah: Well, when you're done with your fixer, you can send him my way.
Lizzie: Come on, this is stupid. Can we go now? My feet are killing me.
Jonathan: Then leave.

Lizzie: We're going to get caught. I am going to get sent to Ravenwood to 
have your baby in a straight jacket and you're going to go to jail. Tammy 
doesn't want to see you right now.
Jonathan: I don't care. Tammy!
Tammy: Jonathan, what are you doing?

Jonathan: Tammy, you can't throw away the best thing that either one of us 
has ever had. What is he doing up there with you?
Tammy: Jonathan, go home.

Jonathan: He's trying to pull you away from me. Can't you see that? I'm 
coming up.
Tammy: Go home and be with your wife and your child.
Jonathan: Tammy! Hey, Tammy!
Next on "Guiding Light"...
Leah: You cheated on mom? Who was it? Do I know her?

Beth: Maybe if you had been a better wife, he wouldn't have needed this room 
or me.
Ava: Maybe there's something else you can teach me. Teach me to be ruthless.
Olivia: I need something from you. You may be the only person who can help.
